page.title: 02Farming around the villages
page.content: Farming affects much of the life of the area. The Marston Estate and its tenant farms follow the policy of mixed farming. There are two dairy herds on the estate and one at Manor Farm. Beef and sheep are reared but the most important is arable farming. The tenant farms in our area are Home Farm Marston St Lawrence, Manor Farm Marston St Lawrence and Westhorpe Manor Farm Greatworth. Greatworth's Farms cultivate to produce cereals and beef,kale is grown for cattle feeding. The land is too heavy for potatoes.Hay is made in the summer months for winter feed. Most of the corn is autumn sown with wheat, barley and some beans produced. The farm also keeps sheep. The two breeds used are Border Leicester and Suffolk.
